intro: Psychotria faucicola, commonly known as the "devil's weed," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. It contains alkaloids, including the psychoactive compound dimethyltryptamine (DMT), which has attracted scientific and cultural interest. Due to its hallucinogenic properties, it is often found in traditional Amazonian shamanic practices.
